artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.2; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: head and upper body of reclining woman, with her PL hand behind her head, face upturned, eyes closed and tongue sticking out slightly, with her PR arm in front of her; woman wearing blue kimono with bird patterns in white, pink and red undergarment and brown, yellow, grey and blue obi with flower band; blue and white bowl in LLC, papers and brown box and small papers (?) in LRC; vertical line of text in brown in left margin
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ{Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田刀 {Wada tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 2 on the table of contents.
title: Appearing Relaxed, Behavior of a Kyoto Geisha of the Kansai Era
